histogram.name: Download.ApiFunctions
histogram.summary: Downloads extension API function calls.

histogram.name: Download.AttachmentServices.Duration
histogram.summary: Time taken to invoke IAttachmentExecute::Save() excluding the time taken to instantiate CLSID_AttachmentServices.

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 05/2021. Use Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond2 instead as it has higher bucket range.
histogram.summary: Overall bandwidth seen for the download. Note that this is measured at the point at which the file is written, and so will not take into account the time costs of activities that occur after file write is completed (e.g. safe browsing scanning).

histogram.name: Download.BandwidthOverallBytesPerSecond2
histogram.summary: Overall bandwidth seen for a completed download. This includes all file downloads going through the download subsystem, but excludes all the page saves. Note that this is measured at the point at which the file is written, and so will not take into account the time costs of activities that occur after file write is completed (e.g. safe browsing scanning). The maximum bucket range is 200Mbps.

histogram.name: Download.CancelReason
histogram.summary: Records why the download is canceled.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType.Audio
histogram.summary: Types of audio files that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType.Image
histogram.summary: Types of images that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType.Text
histogram.summary: Types of text files that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.ContentType.Video
histogram.summary: Types of video files that are downloaded.

histogram.name: Download.Counts
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system; see DownloadCountType for details.

histogram.name: Download.CountsChrome
histogram.summary: Various individual counts in the download system, for example the number of downloads blocked by throttling from the DownloadRequestLimiter.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousDialog.Events
histogram.summary: Records user interactions with the dangerous download dialog on Android. Records when the dialog is shown, or when user clicks on a button or dismisses the dialog.

histogram.name: Download.DangerousFile.DownloadValidatedByType
histogram.summary: User chose to save a download which was marked DANGEROUS_FILE. Grouped by the type of file.

histogram.name: Download.Database.IsAvailable
histogram.summary: Records whether the download database is available when database startup completes, before starting any pending downloads. If the database is available, it will provide the next download id. Or no download history will be persisted.

histogram.name: Download.DeleteRetentionTime.Audio
histogram.summary: How long users keep downloaded audio files on disk. Recorded when the downloaded file is deleted.

histogram.name: Download.DeleteRetentionTime.Video
histogram.summary: How long users keep downloaded video files on disk. Recorded when the downloaded file is deleted.

histogram.name: Download.DOMEvent
histogram.summary: User actions in chrome://downloads

histogram.name: Download.DownloadDangerPrompt
histogram.summary: Records when user is shown the download danger prompt while attempting to recover a blocked download from chrome://downloads, grouped by the type of file.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadManager.CreationDelay
histogram.summary: Records the delay of creating non-incognito download manager after the download system is initialized.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadManager.MemoryUsage
histogram.summary: Records the approximate memory usage from non-incognito download manager, after all downloads are loaded.

histogram.name: Download.DownloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of successfully completed downloads.

histogram.name: Download.DuplicateDialogEvent.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records user interactions on the duplicate download dialog on Android, either for a regular download or an offline page. One user interaction could trigger multiple histograms to be recorded. For example, clicking the text link could record both the link click histogram and the dialog dismiss histogram.

histogram.name: Download.DuplicateInfobarEvent.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records user interactions on the duplicate download infobar on Android, either for a regular download or an offline page.

histogram.name: Download.DuplicateInProgressDownloadIdCount
histogram.summary: The total number of download IDs that are duplicate in the in-progress downloads DB, capped at 10.

histogram.name: Download.HistoryPropagatedUpdate
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Denotes whether the history result should be updated. Recorded when the download is updated.

histogram.name: Download.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes for download requests.

histogram.name: Download.InitiatedByWindowOpener
histogram.obsolete: Expired after M85. No longer in use.
histogram.summary: Records the type of the window.opener origin when a download is initiated in a tab by that tab's opener (crbug.com/121259).

histogram.name: Download.InProgressDB.Counts
histogram.summary: Various individual counts related to in-progress download DB.

histogram.name: Download.InsecureBlocking.Extensions
histogram.summary: Records file extension of download to support analysis for mixed content file download blocking. Warning: this histogram was expired from M94 through M95; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Download.InsecureBlocking.Totals
histogram.summary: Records security state of downloads to support analysis for mixed content file download blocking.

histogram.name: Download.InsecureBlocking.Verification
histogram.obsolete: Expired after M92. No longer in use.
histogram.summary: Records mime-type of download to support analysis for mixed content file download blocking. This is a temporary metric for investigating differences in metrics. Warning: this histogram was expired from M92 through M95; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Download.InterruptedReason
histogram.summary: The reason that a download was interrupted.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadARModelState.USDZ
histogram.summary: Logged at different stages of downloading a USDZ MIME type AR model on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadedFileAction
histogram.summary: The action that a user takes on a file after it has been successfully downloaded on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadedFileNetError
histogram.summary: Positive net error codes that happen in the case of download content fetch failure.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadedFileStatusCode
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08-2018. Recording code was removed in crrev.com/c/1170128.
histogram.summary: HTTP status code returned when file download completes on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadFileInBackground
histogram.summary: Logged when the download is completed (successfully or not) or in-progress download was cancelled because of the app termination. This histogram includes information whether the download was successful and whether or not the download task was running while the app was active.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadFileResult
histogram.summary: Result when a user attempts to download a file on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadFileUI
histogram.summary: Result when a user attempts to present the download UI on iOS. Looged when download is created.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadFileUIGoogleDrive
histogram.summary: Result when the download UI is prexsented on iOS. Values indicate if Google Drive is installed and whether or not Install Google Drive promo was shown. Logged when download is updated.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadMimeType
histogram.summary: MIME type of a download response. Logged when the download UI was offered by the browser to the user.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadMobileConfigFileUI
histogram.summary: Result when the warning alert is presented before downloading a .mobileconfig file on iOS. Values indicate if the user has continued the download workflow after the presentation of the warning alert.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadPassKitResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user attempts to download a PassKit file on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSDownloadReplaced
histogram.summary: The user discarded in-progress download and replaced with the new one. Only recorded after the user interacts with a dialog offering the choice between replacing an in-progress download versus downloading separately to a new filename.

histogram.name: Download.IOSPresentAddPassesDialogResult
histogram.summary: Result of an attempt to present Add Passes dialog on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.IOSPresentQLPreviewControllerResult
histogram.summary: Result when a user attempts to present a USDZ MIME type AR model on iOS.

histogram.name: Download.Later.Events
histogram.summary: Records events for download later feature in download core code.

histogram.name: Download.Later.ScheduledDownloadSize
histogram.summary: The size of downloads when the user tries to download at a scheduled time. Recorded when the positive button in download later dialog is clicked.

histogram.name: Download.Later.UI.DialogChoice
histogram.summary: The user selection in the download later dialog. Recorded when the user starts a download, or clicking the change button on download infobar and download home UI.

histogram.name: Download.Later.UI.Events
histogram.summary: Records events for download later feature in download Android UI.

histogram.name: Download.MediaMetadata.Event
histogram.summary: Records events for local media metadata parsing.

histogram.name: Download.MediaParser.Event
histogram.summary: Records events when using media parser to analyze local media files.

histogram.name: Download.MixedContentDialog.Events
histogram.summary: Records user interactions with the mixed content download dialog on Android. Records when the dialog is shown, or when user clicks on a button or dismisses the dialog.

histogram.name: Download.Mobile.DangerousDownloadInfobarEvent
histogram.summary: Records user interactions with the dangerous download infobar on Android.

histogram.name: Download.NetworkConnectionType.Complete
histogram.summary: Network connection type when a download is completed.

histogram.name: Download.NetworkConnectionType.StartNew
histogram.summary: Network connection type when starting a new download.

histogram.name: Download.Notification.Suppressed
histogram.summary: Records each time a notification for a download is suppressed. Note that a single download can experience multiple instances of notification suppression during its lifetime. This histogram is only emitted for Ash Chrome builds.

histogram.name: Download.OpenDownloads.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: Records the profile type for opening the Downloads page. This may be triggered by different entry points like mobile menu, notification or info bar.

histogram.name: Download.OpenDownloadsFromMenu.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: Records the profile type for opening the Downloads page from menu.

histogram.name: Download.OpenMethod
histogram.summary:
Invocation count for methods of opening a download. For some file types, Chrome defaults to opening the file in the browser instead of invoking the system handler. The user has the option of overriding this behavior.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: Download.OpensOutstanding
histogram.summary: The number of unopened downloads, when one is opened.

histogram.name: Download.OverwrittenDownloadRemovedFromHistory
histogram.summary: Records the number of overwritten downloads that are cleaned up from Chrome://downloads history. Recorded after loading all the downloads from history DB.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.CreationEvent
histogram.summary: When parallel downloading feature is enabled, a download may be created as parallel download or fall back to normal download based on various factors. Records the total number of parallel and non-parallel downloads created when parallel downloading feature is enabled. Also records the reason why a parallel download falls back to normal download. The reasons are not mutually exclusive.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownload.CreationFailureReason
histogram.summary: Records the received failure reason after sending a parallel download request.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownloadAddStreamSuccess
histogram.summary: Records if the byte stream reader of a subsequent request is successfully added to the download sink.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelDownloadRequestCount
histogram.summary: The total number of requests sent for a parallel download, including the initial request.

histogram.name: Download.Parallelizable.DownloadTime
histogram.summary: The download time for a parallelizable download.

histogram.name: Download.Parallelizable.FileSize
histogram.summary: The download size of a parallelizable download.

histogram.name: Download.ParallelizableDownloadBandwidth
histogram.summary: For parallelizable download, average disk bandwidth seen for different settings. If a download was ever paused, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: Download.PathGenerationEvent
histogram.summary: The download path generation behavior which happens before download path validation in download target determination process.

histogram.name: Download.PathValidationResult
histogram.summary: The download path validation result before the final download target is determined.

histogram.name: Download.Progress.InfoBar.CloseButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Records the state of the download progress infobar on android when the user taps on the infobar's close button.

histogram.name: Download.Progress.InfoBar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records various types of messages representing the state of the downloads as they are shown on the download progress infobar on android.

histogram.name: Download.QuarantineService.ConnectionError
histogram.summary: Whether a connection error has happened for the QuarantineService.

histogram.name: Download.ResultsRenderedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to load the downloads Web UI and render (at least) a screen full of items. This is roughly equivalent to 'time to first meaningful paint' for the downloads page.

histogram.name: Download.Resume.AutoResumeLimitReached
histogram.summary: Records whenever max auto-resumption limit was reached for a download.

histogram.name: Download.Resume.AutoResumeLimitReached.LastReason
histogram.summary: Records the last interrupt reason for this download when the download reaches auto-resumption limit.

histogram.name: Download.Resume.LastReason
histogram.summary: Records the last interrupt reason for this download.

histogram.name: Download.Resume.UserResume
histogram.summary: Records whether a resumption was due to user.

histogram.name: Download.ResumptionRestart.Reason
histogram.summary: Records the interrupt reason when download is restarting from the beginning during resumption.

histogram.name: Download.SavePackage
histogram.summary: Events (e.g. Started, Cancelled, Finished, Write to Completed file, Write to Failed file) occuring within the state machine of a SavePackage operation.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Db.Operation.Failure
histogram.summary: Records a failed database operation.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Db.Operation.Success
histogram.summary: Records a successful database operation.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Db.Records
histogram.summary: The total number of database records used by download service, and the number of records in each entry state.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Driver.InterruptReason
histogram.summary: The interrupt reason for failed downloads in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Entry.Event
histogram.summary: An action the download service took on an active download.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Entry.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Records how many attempts have taken place at the time of a retry for a download in the Download Service. This differs from Download.Service.Entry.ResumptionCount, which records resumptions not complete restarts.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.CleanUp.External
histogram.summary: The number of files that have been deleted by external application or the user, when performing clean up tasks in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.CleanUp.Failure
histogram.summary: The number of failed file deletion attempts, when performing clean up tasks in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.CleanUp.Success
histogram.summary: The number of files successfully deleted, when performing clean up tasks in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.DirCreationError
histogram.summary: The error code when failed to create the download directory.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.FreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: The percentage of free disk space to total disk space. Recorded during initialization of the file monitor.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Files.LifeTime
histogram.summary: The lifestime of a download file, which begins from the download completion to the file being deleted by the clean up task.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Finish.Time
histogram.summary: The time to complete the download in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Finish.Type
histogram.summary: The completion type for downloads in download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.OnUploadDataReceived.PauseReason
Download.Service.PauseReason
histogram.summary: The reason for pausing an in-progress download. Every pause will result in two entries in the histogram: ANY and a more specific reason.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Request.ClientAction
histogram.summary: Records the API calls on download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.StartUpStatus
histogram.summary: The start up result of the download service.

histogram.name: Download.Service.TaskScheduler.Status
histogram.summary: The platform background tasks used by download service will invoke native functions after being scheduled. The tasks may be aborted or canceled. This metric records the status of background tasks when native functions are invoked.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Upload.EntryNotFound
histogram.summary: Records if the entry has been deleted for some reason while we are waiting for the client to respond with the upload data.

histogram.name: Download.Service.Upload.HasUploadData
histogram.summary: The download service uses a single code path for both downloading and uploading data. This metric records whether a given request includes upload data. It is recorded upon starting a download or upload, immediately after the client indicates whether the request includes upload data.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.DragEvent
histogram.summary: Events related to dragging a completed download from the shelf, which represents dragging a reference to the downloaded file.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.VisibleTime
histogram.summary: The time that the download shelf was visible until it was closed. This histogram excludes times when DoUnhide() and DoHide() are called (i.e., when the full screen state changes).

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.WebUI.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad event and the render frame DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the download shelf WebUI page.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.WebUI.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the download shelf WebUI page.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.{Framework}.FirstDownloadPaintTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took from the moment the {Framework} download shelf was called to show the first download on the shelf view to when the associated download item is visible.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.{Framework}.NotFirstDownloadPaintTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took from the moment the {Framework} download shelf was called to show a download on the shelf view other than the first one to when the associated download item is visible.

histogram.name: Download.Shelf.{Framework}.ShowContextMenuTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took from pressing a {Framework} download item's chevron button to immediately before the context menu is shown.

histogram.name: Download.ShelfContextMenuAction
histogram.summary: This histogram is used to record the different actions and events associated with the download shelf context menu on Linux, MacOS, and Windows. Specifically, it records when the dropdown button was clicked as well when DownloadCommands were enabled or executed. Each action or enable event is only emitted once; as a result, it is safe to compute a ratio by dividing enabled events by clicked events.

histogram.name: Download.ShowDangerousDownloadConfirmationPrompt
histogram.summary: User saw the confirm prompt to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.

histogram.name: Download.ShowedDownloadWarning
histogram.summary:
A download warning was shown in the shelf. Note that some downloads may not be shown on the shelf, e.g., if chrome://downloads is already open when the download completes, or if an extension is using the downloads API. Grouped by the type of danger. This histogram is logged on ChromeOS since M93.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: Download.SourcesChrome
histogram.summary: The initiation source (if initiated within the above-content layer of chrome) for a download.

histogram.name: Download.Start.ContentType
histogram.summary: Content types of the downloads.

histogram.name: Download.Start.ContentType.NormalProfile
histogram.summary: Content types of the downloads that are started in non-incognito profile.

histogram.name: Download.Start.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: The browser profile type for each download started, recorded just after download successfully started.

histogram.name: Download.UserValidatedDangerousDownload
histogram.summary:
User chose to save a download which was marked dangerous. Grouped by the type of danger.
This metric is used to populate a dashboard on go/crsb-site.

histogram.name: Download.VideoThumbnail.Event
histogram.summary: Records events for local video thumbnail retrieval.

histogram.name: Download.WinFileMoveError
histogram.summary: Records the OS error code when moving a file on windows.
